invocation.name: Band of Brothers (Shaman I)
invocation.boost: 2 points may be taken from each person touched.
3 points may be taken from each person.
invocation.description:
Allows adherents of the same deity to voluntarily transfer luck from themselves to the shaman. The luck can be used to replace luck which has been spent temporarily, and cannot take the shaman to above their normal limit. If the luck is not used by the time the shaman next prays to their god, then it is lost.
One point of luck may be taken from all those who touch the shaman at the time the invocation is invoked.

invocation.name: Initiation (Shaman I)
invocation.description: Initiates a person into the tribe, making them known to their god so that they may use luck.

invocation.name: Spirit Blessing (Shaman I)
invocation.description: A ritual in which the favour of the god or totem spirit is asked for. Those who partake in the ritual receive one point of luck, up to a maximum of two.

invocation.name: True Name (Shaman I)
invocation.description: Learn the unique true name of the subject touched.

invocation.name: Spirit Release (Shaman I)
invocation.description: A funeral ceremony. Spirit of the deceased may resist if they do not yet wish to go on their way.

invocation.name: Spirit Balm (Shaman I)
invocation.boost: Also heals a wound level, and all stuns.
invocation.description: When used on an injured person, stops bloodloss and stabalises the wound.

invocation.name: Spirit Walking (Spirit II)
invocation.description: The shaman's spirit is able to leave their body, and travel as an ethereal entity. The shaman cannot interact with the physical world, but can affect (and be affected by) other spirits. The shaman's body will appear to be in a coma whilst the spirit has left it.

invocation.name: Fasting I
invocation.description: Shaman is unaffected by thirst or hunger while the invocation lasts. The shaman cannot use this more than once a month.

invocation.name: Feast of the Victor I
invocation.description:
This ritual is used to prepare the body of a sapient ready for a cannibal feast. With it, a part of the body's soul is shared out to those who partake in the feast, granting them the skill of the consumed person. Each person gets to make a single roll to improve a skill, as per the training rules, at a quality of two. A skill cannot be improved if the consumed did not have a better skill than the eater.
The body must be fresh, since the level of skills available will deteriate quite quickly over time.

invocation.name: Beastfriend
invocation.description:
Calls an animal within range which will be friendly. Unless the animals True Name is used. The animal will approach close enough to be touched, helping a shaman in distress is need be. Communication with the animal is not granted, but it will be friendly until it next sleeps.
Unless a specific animal is asked for, the nearest will be chosen. The type of animal - either by species or capabilities - may be specified. For example, 'an animal I can ride', or 'a sparrow' are possible requests.

invocation.name: Voice of Darkness
invocation.time:
1 round Near Momentary Low/1 15 Will Range is short (50m) Range is medium (100m)
The priest utters a bloodcurdling shriek - the sound of a soul being ripped from a living body. Anyone within range must make a will check, or flee. Those who fail by 10 or more, faint.

invocation.name: True Arrow
invocation.difficulty: Blesses a quiver of arrows, giving them a +1 bonus to damage. The invocation ends after the arrows have been used, or the next sunset.

invocation.name: True Blade
invocation.difficulty: Blesses one weapon for a single blow, doubling that weapon's damage bonus.

invocation.name: Way of the Fisherman
invocation.difficulty: Blesses a single subject such that one maritime skill roll is increased by one fifth the invocation roll.

invocation.name: Way of the Hunter
invocation.difficulty: Blesses a single subject such that one wilderness skill roll is increased by one fifth the invocation roll.

invocation.name: Swift Blade
invocation.difficulty: Grants a bonus to the attack rolls for a single weapon skill for the subject touched. The bonus is equal to one fifth the invocation roll made by the shaman. The bonus lasts until the end of the current battle.

invocation.name: False Age
invocation.difficulty: The subject touched will begin aging at a rate of one year for each hour that the invocation lasts. At the end of the time, the subject will start growing younger at a similar rate until they have reached their true age again. The subject will have to make aging rolls if they get too old. A roll is needed each hour they are above 35.

invocation.name: Lingering Death
invocation.difficulty: Causes an open wound to become infected.
